==References== {{Reflist}} *Walther, Ingo F. and Norbert Wolf. ''Codices Illustres: The world's most famous illuminated manuscripts, 400 to 1600''. Köln, TASCHEN, 2005. *Weitzmann, Kurt. ''Late Antique and Early Christian Book Illumination''. New York: George Braziller, 1977.
==Further reading== *Leslie Brubaker, “The Vienna Dioskurides and Anicia Juliana” in ''Byzantine Garden Culture'' ed. Antony Robert Littlewood, Henry Maguire, and Joachim Wolschke-Bulmahn (Washington, D.C.: Dumbarton Oaks Research Library and Collection, 2002). *[[Kurt Weitzmann|Weitzmann, Kurt]], ed., ''[http://libmma.contentdm.oclc.org/cdm/ref/collection/p15324coll10/id/156533 Age of spirituality: late antique and early Christian art, third to seventh century]'', no. 179, 1979, [[Metropolitan Museum of Art]], New York, {{ISBN|9780870991790}}; full text available online from The Metropolitan Museum of Art Libraries *Lazaris, Stavros, "[https://cnrs.academia.edu/stavrosLazaris/Papers/1433121/Lillustration_des_disciplines_medicales_dans_lAntiquite_hypotheses_enjeux_nouvelles_interpretations L’illustration des disciplines médicales dans l’Antiquité : hypothèses, enjeux, nouvelles interprétations]", in: ''La Collezione di testi chirurgici di Niceta (Firenze, Biblioteca Medicea Laurenziana, Plut. 74.7). Tradizione medica classica a Bisanzio'', M. Bernabò (ed.), Roma, 2010, pp. 99–109 *Lazaris, Stavros, "[https://www.academia.edu/attachments/32596548/download_file?st=MTQxNzUzOTUyNCwxMzAuNzkuMTIwLjI0NCw0NTgyNTQ%3D&s=work_strip L’image paradigmatique : des Schémas anatomiques d’Aristote au De materia medica de Dioscoride]", ''Pallas'', 93 (2013), pp. 131–164

{{Infobox film | name = Who the Hell is Juliette? | image = | caption = | director = [[Carlos Marcovich]] | producer = [[Alameda Films]], [[Simon Bross]] | writer = [[Carlos Marcovich]] | starring = Yuliet Ortega
Fabiola Quiroz
Jorge Quiroz
Victor Ortega
Michele Ortega | music = | cinematography = | editing = | studio = | distributor = [[Kino International (company)|Kino International]] | released = {{Film date|1998|03|27|df=y}} | runtime = 91 minutes | country = [[Mexico]] | language = [[Spanish language|Spanish]] with [[English language|English]] subtitles | budget = | title= | gross = }} '''''Who the Hell is Juliette?''''' ({{lang-es|'''¿Quién diablos es Juliette?'''}}) is a [[Mexico|Mexican]] [[1997 in film|1997]] documentary film written and directed by [[Carlos Marcovich]].{{cite news |first=Peter M. |last=Nichols |title=Home Video; In Stalin Musicals They Sing of Coal |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2000/09/01/movies/home-video-in-stalin-musicals-they-sing-of-coal.html |work=[[The New York Times]] |date=2000-09-01 |accessdate=2006-08-06 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6JDtuuGtn |archivedate=2013-08-28 }} The film is about Yuliet Ortega, a teenage [[prostitute]] who lives in [[Havana]], [[Cuba]] and Fabiola Quiroz, a Mexican model.{{cite news |first=Jeff |last=Vice |title=Who the Hell is Juliette? |url=http://movies.deseretnews.com/Who-the-Hell-Is-Juliette/review/11307 |work=[[Deseret News]] |date=1998-08-26 |accessdate=2013-08-28 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6JDtiYfKW |archivedate=2013-08-28 }}{{cite news |first=Mick |last=LaSalle |title='Juliette' Leaves a Strong Impression: Teen prostitute holds together poetic film |url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/1998/10/02/DD19466.DTL |work=[[San Francisco Chronicle]] |date=1998-10-02 |accessdate=2006-08-06 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5ipoxLfeP |archivedate=2009-08-06 }} Marcovich intentionally misspelled the [[title character]], "Yuliet Ortega", as "Juliette Ortega" in the [[motion picture credits|credits]].{{cite news |title=Quien Diablos es Juliette? (Who the Hell is Juliette?) (Unrated) *** |url=http://nl.newsbank.com/nl-search/we/Archives?p_product=MH&s_site=miami&p_multi=MH&p_theme=realcities&p_action=search&p_maxdocs=200&p_topdoc=1&p_text_direct-0=0EB4DA1D5BF0AE25&p_field_direct-0=document_id&p_perpage=10&p_sort=YMD_date:D&s_trackval=GooglePM |work=[[Miami Herald]] |date=1998-05-01 |accessdate=2006-08-06 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5ipozlCb2 |archivedate=2006-08-06 }} Marcovich met Fabiola Quiroz during the shooting of a [[music video]]. He met Yuliet Ortega in Cuba and decided that she would be the younger sister of Quiroz in the music video. Marcovich features the similarities of the two women: [[eye color#Green|green eyes]] and persistent thoughts about their missing fathers.{{cite book |title=The Scarecrow Video Movie Guide |year=2004 |publisher=[[Sasquatch Books]] |location=Seattle |isbn=1-57061-415-6 |page=363 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=0qiQLs-6SocC&pg=PA363&dq=%22Who+the+Hell+is+Juliette%3F%22&ei=HEd7StvuMJeSkASbs8i5DQ#v=onepage&q=%22Who%20the%20Hell%20is%20Juliette%3F%22&f=false |accessdate=2006-08-06 }} After shooting the music video, he filmed the two women over a period of three years and created the film, ''Who the Hell is Juliette?''{{cite news |first=David |last=Kehr |title=A 'Hell of a Look at Latinas' Lives |url=http://www.nydailynews.com/archives/entertainment/1998/04/01/1998-04-01_a__hell__of_a_look_at_latina.html |work=[[New York Daily News]] |date=1998-04-01 |accessdate=2006-08-06 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5ipp2bzNh |archivedate=2009-08-06 }} The film was filmed in Cuba, Mexico, and the [[United States]].{{cite news |title=Latino Fest Happenings |url=http://www.nydailynews.com/archives/ny_local/2000/08/01/2000-08-01_latino_fest_happenings.html |work=[[New York Daily News]] |date=2000-08-11 |accessdate=2006-08-06 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5ipqNhD0q |archivedate=2009-08-06 }} ==Plot== ''Who the Hell is Juliette?'' begins with Yuliet Ortega saying that her name on the [[intertitle|title card]], Juliette Ortega, is misspelled and demanding that it is corrected. The director immediately complies and the card is corrected to Yuliet Ortega. Ortega is a 16-year-old girl who is being taken care of by her grandmother. Her mother committed [[suicide]], while her father left his family and went to the United States. Ortega became a [[jineterismo|jinetera]] to support herself. During the shooting of a music video, Ortega meets 23-year-old Fabiola Quiroz who is a Mexican [[model (person)|model]]. Both Quiroz and Ortega have been abandoned by their fathers and are deeply scarred by what has happened. Director Carlos Marcovich organizes a reunion for Ortega and her father, who lives in [[New Jersey]]. Finally, to save Ortega from [[street prostitution]], Fabiola Quiroz helps her arrange a modeling [[interview]]. [[Salma Hayek]] and [[Francesco Clemente]] make guest appearances in the documentary.{{cite news |first=Ted |last=Shen |title=Who the Hell Is Juliette? |url=http://www.chicagoreader.com/chicago/index.html/movies/capsules/17330_WHO_THE_HELL_IS_JULIETTE |work=[[Chicago Reader]] |date=200 |accessdate=7 August 2009 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5irAVB9Tm |archivedate=2009-08-07 }} ==Reception== ===Critical reaction=== ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'' called the film the "artiest home movie ever made" and was critical about how the [[subtitles]] appeared and disappeared too quickly to be easily read.{{cite news |first=Mike |last=D'Angelo |title=Video Review: Who the Hell is Juliette? |url=http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,274874,00.html |work=[[Entertainment Weekly]] |date=1999-03-19 |accessdate=2006-08-06 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5ipp4bPih |archivedate=2009-08-06 }} On the other hand, the ''[[New York Daily News]]'' called the film "a great example of what happens when a film maker follows a subject that intrigues him rather than a pre-set program". ===Awards=== The documentary received two [[Ariel Award]]s.{{cite news |first=Erik |last=McClanahan |title=Brotherly love: A conversation with "Rudo y Cursi" director Carlos Cuarón |url=http://www.tcdailyplanet.net/article/2009/06/01/brotherly-love-conversation-carlos-cuaron.html |work=[[Twin Cities Daily Planet]] |date=2009-06-01 |accessdate=2006-08-06 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5ipqlB3qt |archivedate=2009-08-06 }} At the 1998 [[Sundance Film Festival]], it received the Latin American Cinema Award.{{cite news |first=Janet |last=Maslin |title=Various Guises of Misery in Sundance Winners |url=https://www.nytimes.com/1998/01/26/movies/various-guises-of-misery-in-sundance-winners.html |work=[[The New York Times]] |date=1998-01-26 |accessdate=2006-08-06 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6JDty75WM |archivedate=2013-08-28 }} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * {{IMDb title|id=0126627|title=Who the Hell is Juliette?}} * {{Amg movie|158737|Who the Hell is Juliette?}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Who The Hell Is Juliette?}} [[Category:1997 films]] [[Category:1990s documentary films]] [[Category:Mexican films]] [[Category:Films shot in Havana]] [[Category:Spanish-language films]] [[Category:Mexican documentary films]] [[Category:Documentary films about women]] [[Category:Self-reflexive films]] [[Category:Documentary films about prostitution]] [[Category:Prostitution in Mexico]]
